title: Personalized Health Management Education Based on Nutrigenomics in K-12 Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic genetics and nutrition concepts
context.additional_context: Learners participate through asynchronous interactions using digital devices. Education centered on nutrigenomics application cases within social contexts

learning_goals: Learners can generate at least three research questions for personalized diet design by applying core concepts of nutrigenomics.
Learners can write an experimental design report explaining fatty acid metabolism and gene expression regulation mechanisms.
Learners can analyze publicly available nutrigenomics data and prepare a report proposing health-promotion strategies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
